dt: {bc}operated, moved, or effected by means of water
{bc}of or relating to water or other liquid in motion
{bc}operated by the resistance offered or the pressure transmitted when a quantity of liquid (such as water or oil) is forced through a comparatively small orifice or through a tube

et: Latin {it}hydraulicus{/it}, from Greek {it}hydraulikos{/it}, from {it}hydraulis{/it} hydraulic organ, from {it}hydr-{/it} + {it}aulos{/it} reed instrument {ma}{mat|alveolus|}{/ma}
shortdef: operated, moved, or effected by means of water
of or relating to water or other liquid in motion

dt.t: The gas-fired plants come courtesy of the revolution in {wi}hydraulic fracturing{/wi} ("fracking"), which has delivered a vast supply of low-cost natural gas to an electricity market that has struggled with steadily rising coal prices since 2001.

aq.auth: Jerry Taylor and Peter Van Doren
